doc.after: The audience for this speech included Admiral Karl DÃ¶nitz and Armaments Minister Albert Speer. DÃ¶nitz successfully claimed at the Nuremberg trials that he had had no knowledge of the Final Solution. Speer declared at the trial and in a subsequent interview that "If I didn't see it, then it was because I didn't want to see it."[254] The text of this speech was not known at the time of their post-war trials.
